TopicTitle: Isn't the KSP community so great?

Articles.Content: So many brilliant and talented people... It's awesome!

Yes it is. Still is, but it's getting a little nasty sometimes. But it's among the best forums I've seen. Almost everyone is helpful, and even though I haven't posted very much myself, I have learned a great deal of being here.

Thanks!
I agree with this - full of inventors, writers and people who just understand each other with such politness - Its beautiful really

We do our best to keep it friendly here.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Sometimes. Sometimes not.
It's the best gaming community I've ever been a part of.

I agree, and I think it's partially due to the higher average age of the forum user.

Definitely better than most, but every forum has a few bad apples. I'd say we're even better than the BI Studio forum (the ArmA games), since despite the high average age there, it's a lot of elitists and a few hackers as well.

I think the main reason is because KSP is a hard game to do even basic things in, so quite a few users come to these forums looking for help, find nice people to give them advice, and thus they follow the trend later. It's a wonderful cycle =3
I'm not a bad apple, just a sour one.

Having watched the decline of the Minecraft forums and after being briefly exposed to that wretched hive of scum and villainry known as the DayZ forums, I can attest to this. The smaller community size and the higher skill/intelligence level required in KSP have kept the morons and trolls at bay, though this place definitely isn't as good as it used to be.

I seem to remember seeing a poll about it just a week or three ago...

As to the decorum of the forums this is certainly one of the nicer ones I have seen. I can think of a few others that compare to it however they are either very small, or large but with a tiny active user base.

Having watched the decline of the Minecraft forums and after being briefly exposed to that wretched hive of scum and villainry known as the DayZ forums, I can attest to this. The smaller community size and the higher skill/intelligence level required in KSP have kept the morons and trolls at bay, though this place definitely isn't as good as it used to be.

Oh, and the multiplayer, that's something special. That's why I used to go with singleplayer mode only. I've tried multiplayer Minecraft and chances are you'll end up in a dystopian society of North Korea type, or Mad Max type.

So I stick with my sheep, pigs, chickens and dogs, all alone. No Herobrine, either.

This is a great community because the people here like to help each other. When people post a achievement (like first Mun landing) people congratulate the poster and give him/her tips and tricks. Most other gaming communities are competitive in nature. When someone posts an achievement there every reaction is about how the commenter did it better.

One of the best examples I've seen is Whackjob's first thread about grief and coffee - the amount of support and admiration for a new player's designs makes me proud to be a ( albeit somewhat lurker-ish ) member of this community

Having come from Eve Online and their forums, I still can't get use to this forum. I hardly ever see flaming here, and the trolling is very mild in comparison. It's wonderful, but I can't shake my suspicion Eve broke me!

Thank you KSP people!
